intro: Chlorophytum zenkeri, commonly known as the Tiger's Tail Plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its long, arching leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers in clusters during the summer months. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its unique appearance and low maintenance make it a popular choice for both indoor and outdoor gardens.
